Legal_Issue: Adequacy of the Board's analysis of religious persecution claim
Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, involvement in underground Christian church
Evaluation_Standard: Real risk of persecution upon return
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Involvement with underground Christian church in China
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection hearing, followed by judicial review
Application_Error: Failure to fully assess future risk of persecution
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside, new hearing ordered
Evidence_Ignored: Risk of future persecution despite past membership
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution on religious grounds
Application_Factor: Membership in a particular social group (underground Christians)
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule: Board must assess credible evidence and real risk of persecution
Outcome_of_Review: Judicial review allowed, new hearing ordered
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of credibility and insufficient evidence of ongoing risk
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 97(1) - Definition of Convention refugee
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient consideration of country conditions and religious repression
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to provide adequate reasons constitutes breach
Credibility_Issues: Board found applicant's testimony lacking credibility
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural fairness and incomplete analysis
Relevant_Law: Charter of Rights and Freedoms, IRPA, UN Refugee Convention
Omission_Type: Failure to analyze future risk despite evidence
